sn5.4:1.2: A different set of verses are attributed to her at Thig 6.8:0.3.
sn5.4:2.1: This challenge and response is similar to the verses of Khemā (Thig 6.3).
sn5.4:2.4: Explained by the commentary as one-skinned and two-skinned drums, a stringed instrument, a wind instrument, and metal percussion such as gongs, cymbals, etc.
sn5.4:6.1: In this verse she declares that, not only has she transcended attachment to the senses, she has even surmounted attachment to meditative absorption.
